sen.j: 建稲種命（たけいなだねのみこと）は、日本の神。
sen.e: Takeinadane-no-mikoto is a Japanese god.
Takeinadane-no-mikoto is a Japanese god.
Takeinadane no mikoto is a Japanese god.

sen.j: 建稲種公（たけいなだねのきみ）とも称す。
sen.e: The god is also known as Takeinadane-no-kimi.
The god is also known as Takeinadane-no-kimi.
The god is also known as Takeinadane no kimi.

sen.j: 父尾張国造乎止与命（オトヨ）母眞敷刀婢命（マシキトベ）との子で、宮簀媛は妹。
sen.e: His father is Otoyo-no-mikoto, kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor) of Owari Province, his mother is Makishitobe-no-mikoto, and Miyazuhime is his younger sister.
sen.cmt: 用語検索で「尾張国造乎止与命」は"Owarinokuni-no-miyatsuko Totoyo-no-mikoto"とありましたが、原文は"Totoyo"ではなく「オトヨ」となっていますのでこちらで訳しました。
sen.e: His father is Otoyo-no-mikoto, kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor) of Owari Province, his mother is Makishitobe-no-mikoto, and Miyazuhime is his younger sister.
His father is Otoyo no mikoto, kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor) of Owari Province, his mother is Mashikitobe no mikoto, and Miyazuhime is his younger sister.

sen.j: 妃玉姫（丹羽氏の祖大荒田命（オオアラタノミコト）の女）との間に二男四女。
sen.e: He had two sons and four daughters with his wife Tama-hime (a daughter of Oarata-no-mikoto, an ancestor of Niwa clan).
He had two sons and four daughters with his wife Tama-hime (a daughter of Oarata-no-mikoto, an ancestor of Niwa clan).
He had two sons and four daughters with his wife Tama hime (a daughter of Oarata no mikoto, an ancestor of Niwa clan).

sen.j: 息子尻綱根命（シリツナネノミコト）は、応神天皇の大臣。
sen.e: His son Shiritsunane-no-mikoto was a minister in the reign of Emperor Ojin.
His son Shiritsunane-no-mikoto was a minister in the reign of Emperor Ojin.
His son Shiritsunane no mikoto was a minister in the reign of Emperor Ojin.

sen.j: その下の娘は五百城入彦皇子（景行天皇皇子）の妃で、品陀真若王の母。
sen.e: One of his daughters younger than Shiritsunane-no-mikoto was a wife of Prince Iokiiribiko-no-miko (a son of Emperor Keiko) and the mother of Homudamawaka-no-miko.
sen.cmt: 五百城入彦皇子には複数の妃がいたようなので"the wife"ではなく"a wife"としました。
sen.e: One of his daughters younger than Shiritsunane-no-mikoto was a wife of Prince Iokiiribiko-no-miko (a son of Emperor Keiko) and the mother of Homudamawaka-no-miko.
One of his daughters younger than Shiritsunane no mikoto was a wife of Prince Iokiiribiko no miko (a son of Emperor Keiko) and the mother of Homudamawaka no miko.

sen.j: 更にその下の娘金田屋野姫命（カネタヤネノヒメノミコト）は品陀真若王の妃で、応神天皇の皇后仲姫命及び2人の妃の母。
sen.e: Kanetayanenohime-no-mikoto was another daughter of him, younger than the other one, and was the wife of Homudamawaka-no-miko and mother of Empress Nakatsuhime-no-mikoto and two other wives of Emperor Ojin.
sen.cmt: 調べた限りでは品陀真若王に金田屋野姫命以外の妃は見当たりませんでしたので"the wife"としました。
sen.e: Kanetayanenohime-no-mikoto was another daughter of him, younger than the other one, and was the wife of Homudamawaka-no-miko and mother of Empress Nakatsuhime-no-mikoto and two other wives of Emperor Ojin.

Kanetayanenohime no mikoto was another daughter of him, younger than the other one, and was the wife of Homudamawaka no miko and mother of Empress Nakatsuhime no mikoto and two other wives of Emperor Ojin.

sen.j: 景行天皇と成務天皇の二代の間、朝廷に仕え、ヤマトタケル東征の際、副将軍として軍を従え、軍功を挙げたとされる。
sen.e: Takeinadane-no-mikoto served two emperors, Emperor Keiko and Emperor Seimu, and he distinguished himself in the military expedition to the east lead by Yamato Takeru (a legendary hero and a son of Emperor Keiko), taking command of the army as vice-shogun.

Takeinadane-no-mikoto served two emperors, Emperor Keiko and Emperor Seimu, and he distinguished himself in the military expedition to the east lead by Yamato Takeru (a legendary hero and a son of Emperor Keiko), taking command of the army as vice-shogun.

Takeinadane no mikoto served two emperors, Emperor Keiko and Emperor Seimu, and he distinguished himself in the military expedition to the east lead by Yamato Takeru (a legendary hero and a son of Emperor Keiko), taking command of the army as vice shogun.

sen.j: 熱田神宮・内々神社・羽豆神社・鳴海神社・尾張戸神社・八雲神社などに祭られている。
sen.e: He is enshrined to Atsuta-jingu Shrine, Utsutsu-jinja Shrine, Hazu-jinja Shrine, Narumi-jinja Shrine, Owaribe-jinja Shrine, Yakumo-jinja Shrine and so on.
sen.cmt: 原文の(八雲町)はリンク先でしたので訳出しませんでした。
sen.e: He is enshrined to Atsuta-jingu Shrine, Utsutsu-jinja Shrine, Hazu-jinja Shrine, Narumi-jinja Shrine, Owaribe-jinja Shrine, Yakumo-jinja Shrine and so on.
He is enshrined to Atsuta-jingu Shrine, Utsutsu-jinja Shrine, Hazu-jinja Shrine, Narumi-jinja Shrine, Owaribe-jinja Shrine, Yakumo-jinja Shrine and so on.
